intro: Alternanthera praelonga var. australis, commonly known as the Australian Alternanthera, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaranthaceae family. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its striking red or pink foliage, which becomes more vibrant in full sun. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or yellow, clustered in dense spikes. This variety is valued in horticulture for its ornamental leaves and adaptability to various soil conditions.
